title.value: Learning to Scale Logits for Temperature-Conditional GFlowNets
title.justification: The title of the paper is mentioned in the given text.
title.quote: Learning to Scale Logits for Temperature-Conditional GFlowNets

extractions.description: The paper introduces Logit-scaling GFlowNets (Logit-GFN), a novel architectural design for temperature-conditional GFlowNets, which accelerates training and enhances the generalization capabilities. The paper evaluates Logit-GFN on various biochemical tasks, demonstrating improved training stability, offline generalization, and online mode-seeking capabilities compared to other methods.

type.justification: The paper includes empirical evaluations of Logit-GFN on various biochemical tasks, providing experimental results that demonstrate its performance improvements.
type.quote: The paper evaluates Logit-GFN on various biochemical tasks, demonstrating improved training stability, offline generalization, and online mode-seeking capabilities compared to other methods.

primary_research_field.justification: The paper primarily deals with architectural improvements and training methodologies for temperature-conditional GFlowNets, which are generative models within the deep learning field.
primary_research_field.quote: The major benefit of temperature-conditional GFlowNets is that it can adjust the generative policy based on the β, thereby allowing for the management of the exploration-exploitation trade-off.

sub_research_fields.justification: The focus on GFlowNets, which are generative models used for creating diverse samples from a target distribution, places this paper within the subfield of Generative Models.
sub_research_fields.quote: Generative flow networks (GFlowNets) constitute a class of deep generative models and a reinforcement learning (RL) methodology designed to sample compositional objects x ∈ X , given a target distribution specified by an unnormalized density or positive reward function.

name.justification: The main model proposed in the paper is Logit-scaling GFlowNets (Logit-GFN).
name.quote: We propose Logit-scaling GFlowNets (Logit-GFN), a novel architectural design that greatly accelerates the training of temperature-conditional GFlowNets.

caracteristics.justification: Logit-GFN is a type of generative model designed to create diverse samples based on a tempered reward function.
caracteristics.quote: The goal of the temperature-conditional GFlowNets is to train conditional generative models proportional to a tempered reward function, p(x|β) ∝ R(x)β.

name.justification: The QM9 dataset is used for evaluating the performance of the proposed model, Logit-GFN.
name.quote: We present experimental results on 4 biochemical tasks: QM9, sEH, TFBind8, and RNA-binding.

name.justification: The sEH dataset is one of the four biochemical tasks used to empirically test Logit-GFN.
name.quote: We present experimental results on 4 biochemical tasks: QM9, sEH, TFBind8, and RNA-binding.

name.justification: The TFBind8 dataset is utilized in the paper to demonstrate the performance of Logit-GFN.
name.quote: We present experimental results on 4 biochemical tasks: QM9, sEH, TFBind8, and RNA-binding.

name.justification: The RNA-binding dataset is one of the datasets used for empirical validation of Logit-GFN's capabilities.
name.quote: We present experimental results on 4 biochemical tasks: QM9, sEH, TFBind8, and RNA-binding.

name.justification: The paper utilizes the PyTorch library for implementing and training the Logit-GFN models.
name.quote: We implement both baseline and proposed GFlowNet models using the PyTorch framework.
